name: Eternal Pose (to Nanimonai Island)
description: A special compass that permanently points to a specific location on the Grand Line. This particular Eternal Pose pointed to Nanimonai Island, a location near Arabasta that would allow the Straw Hats to bypass dangerous islands on the traditional route.

keyMoments.description: Miss All Sunday offers the Eternal Pose to Vivi, explaining it would provide a safer and faster route to Arabasta.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a tempting shortcut that tests the crew's commitment to their chosen path and Luffy's philosophy.

keyMoments.description: Luffy snatches the Eternal Pose and crushes it without hesitation, declaring that no one else has the right to decide where his crew goes.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most iconic moments in One Piece, establishing Luffy's core values of freedom and self-determination. The destruction of this item becomes a symbol of the crew's philosophy.

symbolism: The Eternal Pose represents the easy path and external control. Its destruction symbolizes Luffy's rejection of shortcuts and his commitment to forging his own destiny, even when faced with danger.
notes: This moment parallels Luffy's later destruction of an Eternal Pose to Laugh Tale in One Piece: Stampede, showing consistency in his character philosophy across the series.
